itemDescription: Scottish association football player and manager (born 1943)

wikipedia_page.main: John Mackin (born 18 November 1943) is a Scottish former professional footballer and manager.

response: After making two league appearances for Middlesbrough in the 1971–72 season, Stone signed for Third Division club York City in July 1972. He made his debut after starting a 1–0 defeat away to Tranmere Rovers on 15 September in York's seventh league match of 1972–73, replacing John Mackin at right back. He finished the season with 34 appearances and five goals for York in all competitions. He spent the season primarily at right back, but played as a striker towards the end of the season, scoring two goals from five matches in this position. In 1973–74, Stone missed three matches, making 51 appearances in all competitions as York finished third in the Third Division, thus winning promotion to the Second Division for the first time in the club's history. An injury sustained in York's 1–0 defeat away to Sunderland on 14 September 1974 resulted in him missing the rest of 1974–75, which he finished with six appearances in all competitions.
